Test Description: Create multiple volumes with m=1,2,3 on all nodes. Run fio with known pattern on volumes. Take snapshot of volumes. Create linked clone volumes out of snapshots. Verify that data is same on volume and its linked clone volume. Do some more IOs on volumes. Verify that data on LCV has not changed. Write on LCV. Data on original volume shouldn't change. Delete LCVs & Snapshots and verify that Data on volumes didn't change.
Create volume of different fstypes (xfs, ext4, ext3) and take its snapshot & create LCV from snapshot. Verify data on volume and LCV

Create volumes. Create file system using mkfs. Mount it. Add files to it. Run sync; sync
Create a snapshot of this volume. Create LCV out of this snapshot. Mount the LCV and check whether the same files are present in LCV which were present in original volume
Expected Behaviour:
if mount fails run the following :
XFS:
xfs_repair -L <dev>
xfs_admin -U generate <dev>

ext4:
fsck <dev>
tune2fs -U time <dev>

Test Description:
Create volumes. Create file system using mkfs. Mount it. Add files to it. Don't run sync; sync
Create a snapshot of this volume. Create LCV out of this snapshot. Mount the LCV and check whether the same files are present in LCV which were present in original volume

NOTE: The data on lcv and volumes may not match without running sysnc;sync command
NOTE: if you unmount original volume and then took snapshot then the data in lcv and volumes should match
Expected Behaviour:
if mount fails run the following :
XFS:
xfs_repair -L <dev>
xfs_admin -U generate <dev>

ext4:
fsck <dev>
tune2fs -U time <dev>

Test Description:
Create volumes. Create file system using mkfs. Don't Mount it. Calculate cksum
Create a snapshot of this volume. Create LCV out of this snapshot. Verify cksum
Create 8 volumes. Run fio. After fio completes, kill / restart bosun. Immediately create snapshot and LCV out of snapshot. Verify data on volume and LCV
Create volumes such that it exhausts all the available space of drives on node. Don't do any IOs. Now create the snapshot. Snapshot will remain in Pending state
Expected Behaviour: Invalid test. if we exhaust all space on drive we will not be able to create snapshot & LCV

Test Description: Create N large size volumes (>200GB) such that it uses a large space of drives on node. Only N * 200GB space should be available on node. Do some IOs. Now create snapshots. Snapshot will go into Available state. Delete the snapshots. Create a few more volumes. Available Space on node < N * 200GB. Now create snapshots. Some snapshots will remain in Pending state. Minimum reservation 200G is needed while creating snapshots for volumes that are bigger than 200G, defined by KDefaultSnapshotSizeOverhead variable
Create volume. Write on entire volume. Take snapshot and then write again on volume exceeding the snap reserve 20%. Write 21%
Expected Behaviour: Result: Able to write more than 20%

Test Description: Create volume. Write on entire volume. Take snapshot and then write on LCV exceeding the snap reserve 20%. Write 21%
Expected Behaviour: Result: Able to write more than 20%

Test Description:
1) Create a volume of max size / available space on node. 
2) Write IOs on the volume such that data is spread across entire volume. 
3) Verify data on entire volume.
4) Create a snapshot of this volume and create LCV out of snapshot. 
5) Verify data on the LCV. Should be same as parent volume.
6) Run fio on the LCV with different pattern.
7) Verify data on parent volume. Shouldn't have changed.
Create volumes, then snapshots and LCVs. Create snapshot out of LCV and LCV out of that snapshot. Verify data. Run this for 2-3 cycles.
Create LCV of smaller size than that of snapshot. Shouldn't allow
Create LCV of larger size than that of snapshot. Shouldn't allow
Expected Behaviour: Result: Able to create and attach LCV of larger size than snapshot

Test Description: Verify that data across mirrored plexes of LCVs are same during/after SS_Basic-1.0 kind of test
Create volume and attach it to a pod. Create a snapshot & LCV out of snapshot. Detach the volume from pod. Attach the LCV to this pod. Verify pod starts running. Try with different QoS and fs-type.
Create volume and attach it to a pod. Create a snapshot & LCV out of snapshot. Create pod 2 that will attach to LCV and run data verification
Attach LCVs to fio pods and verify the expected QoS for local and remote volumes
Expected Behaviour: Was getting lower qos. might be issue withdiamanti/fio-verify image. Was getting lower iops on original volume too

Test Description: Create volumes, do IOs, check data usage using sputil -i. Create snapshots & LCVs out of snapshots, check DU. Do IOs on LCVs, check DU. Delete LCVs & Snapshots and check DU
Expected Behaviour:
After creating snapshot & lcv, usage should not increase.
After writing on lcv, usage should increase.
After deleting lcv, usage should equal to the usage before writing on lcv.
Notes / Detailed Description: If /dev/nvme1n1 is dev path of volume1, then verify its indeed the case

Test Description:
Create 3-way mirrored volume. Create single plex snapshot and LCV out of this volume.
Verify reserved storage space reservation in dctl cluster status. It should take space only from one node where snapshot / lcv is created and not from other 2 nodes which contains other plexes of the parent volume

Assign a common label to 2 nodes of a cluster. Create mirrored volume. Create single plex snapshot and LCV out of this volume with / without node selector. Verify that snapshot / lcv gets scheduled and doesn't get stuck due to same label. Also check reserved storage space whether it takes from only 1 node or both node

Create a volume, attach it, do IOs. Calculate cksum. Create snapshot (say snap1) out of volume. Create lcv (say lcv1) out of snap1. Create snap2 out of lcv1. Create lcv2 out of snap2. Create snap3 out of lcv2. Create lcv3 out of snap3. Attach all lCVs. Calculate cksum. Cksum should be equal to parent (or root) volume. Do IOs on lcv2. Calculate cksum of volume & lCVs again.  Cksum of lcv1, lcv3 should not change and should be equal. And cksum of lcv2 should be different.

Create multiple volumes. Run IOs. Calculate cksum of the volumes. Create snapshots of volumes. Create LCVs out of snapshots. Check cksum of LCVS. They should match with the original volumes. Delete the LCVs. While the LCVs are deleting, Run IOs on the original volumes. There shouldn't be any IO errors. Delete snapshots. While the snapshots are being deleted, Run IOs on the original volumes. There shouldn't be any IO errors. Delete the volumes. FBM and L1 usage should become 0 after all volumes are deleted.

Create volumes of various sizes. Start fio in background. Create a snapshot while the fio is still running. Delete the snapshot after some time while the the IOs are still running. Detach and re-attach the volume. There should be no shared blocks or modified blocks for the volume. 
(check sputil -l -v <vol-idx> | grep SB and sputil -l -v <vol-idx> | grep MB)
